required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effective Rehabilitation of Patients Operated With Total Knee Arthroplasty

collaborator.agency: The Royal Norwegian Ministry of Health

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of maximal strength training (MST) compared to standard rehabilitation in patients operated with total knee arthroplasty. Previous studies report reduced physical function and muscle strength despite successful surgery inserting an artificial implant.
Furthermore, great loss of muscle strength has been found in these patients in the early postoperative phase.
The study is a randomized controlled trial. The investigators hypothesize that MST will increase muscle strength and physical function more than standard rehabilitation.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Muscle strength in leg extension and leg press
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured preoperatively, after 7 days, 10 wks and 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Measured preoperatively implies measuring the outcome within the last month prior to surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: preopertively, 7 days postoperatively and after 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring the outcome preoperatively implies testing within the last month prior to surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: KOOS; Knee injury and osteosarthritis outcome score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperatively (within 1 month prior to surgery), 7 days postoperatively and 10 wks and 1 year postoperatively
Preoperatively (within 1 month prior to surgery), 7 days, 10 wks and 1 year postoperatively
preoperatively (within 1 month prior to surgery), 7 days, 10 wks and 1 year postoperatively

arm_group.description: Training maximal strength training 3 times a week/1 physiotherapy session for 8 weeks
2-3 physiotherapy sessions a week for 8 weeks/telephone contact by project leader once a week/writing training diary

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- unilateral osteoarthritis,
- < 75 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- disease(s) that compromise testing/training,
- unable to understand written and verbal instructions and information,
- osteoarthritis in the contralateral leg that needs treatment.
